name: NSTextLineFragment
desc: A class that represents a line fragment as a single textual layout and rendering unit inside a text layout fragment.

items.name: init(attributedString: NSAttributedString, range: NSRange)
items.desc: Creates a new line fragment from the attributed string for the range of characters you specify.

items.name: init?(coder: NSCoder)
items.desc: Creates a new line fragment with from data in an unarchiver.

items.name: init(string: String, attributes: [NSAttributedString.Key : Any], range: NSRange)
items.desc: Creates a new line fragment using the string, attributes, and range you provide.

items.name: var characterRange: NSRange
items.desc: The string range for the source attributed string that corresponds to this line fragment.

items.name: var glyphOrigin: CGPoint
items.desc: Rendering origin for the left-most glyph in the line fragment coordinate system.

items.name: var typographicBounds: CGRect
items.desc: The typographic bounds that specifies the dimensions of the line fragment for laying out line fragments to each other.

items.name: func characterIndex(for: CGPoint) -> Int
items.desc: Returns character index for a point inside the line fragment coordinate system.

items.name: func fractionOfDistanceThroughGlyph(for: CGPoint) -> CGFloat
items.desc: Returns character index for a point inside the line fragment coordinate system.

items.name: func locationForCharacter(at: Int) -> CGPoint
items.desc: Returns the location of the character at the specified index.

items.name: func draw(at: CGPoint, in: CGContext)
items.desc: Renders the line fragment contents at the rendering origin.
